newsitem.title: UK: UK shares close higher, eyeing UK monetary meet.
newsitem.headline: UK shares close higher, eyeing UK monetary meet.

text.p: UK shares held on to Dow-inspired gains on Wednesday but closed just off the day's worst levels awaiting news on UK interest rates and amid weakness in the U.S.
The London stock market took news of a second U.S. strike on Iraq in its stride but drifted towards the bottom of its trading range when the Dow chalked up modest early losses.
"The Iraqi situation persists but it was last night's turnaround on Wall Street which impacted upon us today," said one head of UK equity sales.
The FTSE 100 index finished 16.8 points up on the day, at 3,872.7. Gainers outweighed decliners by three-and-a-half times.
